summary: This is a 2021 email chain between a federal prosecutor and FedEx legal staff regarding identifying a records custodian to testify at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The emails discuss FedEx records from 2008 related to a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.role: Senior Paralegal at FedEx Legal Department
persons.context: FedEx paralegal corresponding with federal prosecutors about providing a records custodian to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. She reviews records and asks if the case is related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The trial mentioned in the emails is for Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced by Tracy Chapell when she asks "is this 'the' Jeffrey Epstein?", indicating the records request is related to his case.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact who handled a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.

connections.description: Chapell is involved in providing FedEx records for Maxwell's trial as requested by prosecutors.
Chapell's work involves locating FedEx records related to the Epstein investigation.
Maxwell's trial is connected to the Epstein case, as indicated by the reference to Epstein in the context of the records request.
Ferrara was the FedEx contact who handled a 2008 subpoena related to the Epstein investigation from Florida prosecutors.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: FedEx Subpoena from Florida Prosecutors
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent FedEx a subpoena in February 2008 as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prosecutor Seeks FedEx Testimony
events.description: In July 2021, a federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York contacted FedEx to identify a records custodian who could testify at the Maxwell trial regarding 2008 records.

locations: Memphis, TN 38125 (FedEx Legal Department at 3620 Hack Cross Road Building B, 3rd Floor)
New York, New York 10007 (1 Saint Andrews Plaza, Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
Southern District of Florida (referenced as origin of 2008 subpoena)
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors were seeking a FedEx records custodian to testify at Ghislaine Maxwell's November 2021 trial.
The records in question related to a February 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
FedEx paralegal Tracy Chapell explicitly asked if the records request was related to "the' Jeffrey Epstein," confirming the connection.
The email chain shows ongoing evidence gathering by prosecutors in the Maxwell case as recently as July 2021.
The documents reference both the Southern District of Florida's earlier Epstein investigation and the Southern District of New York's Maxwell prosecution.
